__TOC__


== IBM Thinkpad T30, Type 2366 ==

Global Machine Specs: Intel Mobile Pentium 4, 1,8 GHz, 512MB RAM, 14,1" SXGA+ TFT, Mobile Radeon 7500 (detailed specs at the end of this Report)

=== Maverick Meerkat ===
Tested with the live environment from a burned ISO image.

==== Remarks ====
* exc-001: There is no example folder linked in the home folder. After going to /usr/share/example-content, the test case was completed successfully.
* The screen is garbled on startup since the RC, because the resolution was autodetected as 1600x1024 (see <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/657113|#657113]]</nowiki>)
* snr-002: The machine did not enter the first of the sleep states after running the script for the smoke test, the other tests went fine (power drain tested only for 5 minutes though, only 5 iterations of variable sleep time test to prevent hardware damage).
* it's pretty amazing that the built-in wifi started to work out of the box with WPA! This was not the case in former releases (last tried with 9.10). Various sources claim that a firmware upgrade is necessary to get WPA working on this old Prism 2.5 chipset, but this seems not to be the case (or Ubuntu has the firmware included and loads it on boot, I dunno)
